pageContext.claim: “In the country they're going to send out 80 million unsolicited, in other words people that don't even know what a ballot is, all of a sudden here comes the ballot. Now, we don't even know that people are going to get it. That's my problem. Supposedly they're not sending them to Republican neighborhoods.”
pageContext.analysis: All wrong. Some states were mailing ballots to all registered voters, accounting for 51 million voters combined, according to a Washington Post tally. (In California alone, that means 20 million ballots were mailed.) Other states, with a combined 44 million voters, were simply mailing ballot applications. In all of these cases, people had to register to vote before receiving a ballot or ballot application in the mail. Trump falsely and with no evidence claims ballots were not being sent to Republican neighborhoods.
